comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Interesting to compare this with Henry King's photo (c.1890) - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2666190207/ and Kerry's (c.1900) - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362676015/ I think this photo is c.1885

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: At least pre-1891 according to your note about the Dept Lands building being completed in 1891.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The northern half of the Lands Department Building was completed in 1881 (as seen here); the southern half including clock tower with onion "in the early 1890s". There's no sign of the southern half in this photo, so that is why I think pre-1891. It could be any year between 1881 - 1891. Ref - adsabs.harvard.edu/full/1984PASAu...5..606W and following pages.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The terrace on the right which also appears in www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/2627336538/ dated 4 October 1889. The writing on Nos. 5 and 7 in this picture looks like it has been painted over in the other, implying that this photo is earlier than 1889. Unless it is a trick of the light.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] It's hard to tell with those numbers, isn't it. As you say, they are very faint in the other photo. 

With the horses and carts in both images it looks to be an old-fashioned 'taxi stand'.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] That is interesting, particularly because it identifies the handsome building on the left, Australia's first Synagogue. Later buildings in York Street and Elizabeth Street. See slightly contradicting articles - AT&CJ - 28/01/1888, p.34 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/71093743 SMH - 20/06/1913, p.8 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/15429234 Lionel Lindsay print - artsearch.nga.gov.au/Detail.cfm?IRN=92468&PICTAUS=TRUE

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: The New Zealand Loan & Mercantile Agency Building on the corner of Bridge & Loftus Sts appears to have been built in 1882-1883 (see comments on links below)...it was evidently nearing completion in March 1883...and was initially occupied by Trebeck & Son, but only for a brief period...the NZ Loan & Mercantile Agency appear to have acquired the building in ca. April 1884...perhaps moving in during the following months...they evidently remained there into the 20th century. At this resolution it's difficult to tell whether the NZL&MA were occupants at the time this pic was taken...their highly visible sign which we see in this PHM Tyrrell Collection pic taken in the ?mid 1880s doesn't appear to be up www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2533262356/ ...but then we don't see the sign in this ? mid 1890s pic either www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/6819400210/ nor in this ?earlier 20th century pic acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=53345 I wonder whether that's scaffolding we see on the Bridge St side of the building...it's difficult to tell...but if so, maybe we're looking at late 1882 or early 1883...maybe...
